paper_metadata.title: Increasing the accuracy of proteomic typing by decellularisation of amyloid tissue biopsies
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the identification of TTR variants in patients with amyloidosis, focusing on the T60A mutation and its clinical implications.

patients.phenotype: heart failure, amyloid cardiomyopathy, autonomic neuropathy

individual_records.phenotype_details: heart failure, amyloid cardiomyopathy, autonomic neuropathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: TTR gene sequencing showed that he was heterozygous for the known amyloidogenic mutation encoding T60A TTR.

functional_data.summary: The T60A mutation is known to be associated with amyloidogenic properties.

variants.additional_notes: The patient presented with multiple symptoms indicative of amyloidosis.
key_quotes: TTR gene sequencing showed that he was heterozygous for the known amyloidogenic mutation encoding T60A TTR.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the relevant variant was clearly mentioned in the text.
